text: China made a significant change that can
affect the whole world its parliament
has just scrapped presidential term
limits for the last three decades there
was a tradition of limiting presidencies
to ten years but now President Xi
Jinping in theory can stay in office for
as long as he wants he could be on par
with Chairman Mao who ruled until his
death she supporters say he's the man to
steer the country to the right direction
they say he's brought unity stability
and tackled corruption he's also
credited with combating pollution and
projecting economic power but she's
critics say getting rid of term limits
is bad and possibly dangerous they say
it turns China back to one-man rule and
will further weaken its institutions
there is also the fear that President Xi
Jinping will surround himself with
yes-men
so how will a more assertive a more
authoritarian latrina impact all of us
of course whether she will really be
President for life is still too early to
tell how he will use all the political
military economic power that he has at
his hands the answer to this question
could well define the 21st century
